form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of the Interior to convey certain land in Blaine County, Idaho, to the city of Ketchum, Idaho, to be used to support recreation, educational, and public purposes, including river restoration, floodplain management, and municipal water storage, and for other purposes.

section.header: Conveyance of land to Ketchum, Idaho

subsection.text: For the purposes of this Act, the following definitions shall apply:

paragraph.text: The term map means the map titled Ketchum R&PPA Proposal North & South R&PP Parcels and dated 2/2012.
The term Property means the total of approximately 374.5 acres of land in Blaine County, Idaho, generally depicted on the map as North R&PP Parcel and South R&PP Parcel.
The term Secretary means the Secretary of the Interior.

subsection.text: As soon as practicable after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary, acting through the Director of the Bureau of Land Management, shall convey to the city of Ketchum, Idaho, subject to valid existing rights, without consideration, all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to the Property.
The map shall be on file and available for public inspection in the appropriate offices of the Bureau of Land Management.

paragraph.text: The land conveyed under this sections shall be used to support recreation, educational, and public purposes, including river restoration, floodplain management, and municipal water storage.
The land conveyed under this section shall not be used for residential or commercial purposes except for public events and activities that are permitted by the City of Ketchum.
The Secretary of the Interior may require such additional terms and conditions in connection with the conveyance as the Secretary considers appropriate to protect the interests of the United States.

subsection.text: If the land conveyed under this section is no longer used in accordance with subsection (d) the land shall, at the discretion of the Secretary based on the Secretaryâ€™s determination of the best interests of the United States, revert to the United States.

The Secretary shall require that the city of Ketchum, Idaho, pay all survey costs and other administrative costs necessary for the preparation and completion of any patents and transfer of title under this section.
